alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:32PM CDT until June 07 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CUSTER COUNTY... At 731 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ansley, or 18 miles southeast of Broken Bow, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Block Hill Basin, Gavin Siding, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road and Cumro. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 93. Highway 2 between mile markers 293 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 306. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
